ab.q:
Where there is no conflict
There can be no conquest
Where there is no conquest
There is no crown

for stands very eminent

MDCCCCII roman numerals
year 1902 arabic figure

div.ab:
The Proudest view that can
be taken of Man is to see him
like some Fair Vessel proceeding
steadily thro through thro the Ocean
of Time His Sails impelled
by the Feelings and Passions
of a well ordered Mind. His
Irregular Motions controlled
by the Ballast of a Sound
Understanding while Judgement
sits at the Helm with
eyes fixed on the Compass
of Religion and Reason

True quietness of Heart is got
by resisting our passions not by
obeying them

Were Men indeed convinced
that their health and comfort
were so materially dependent upon
the regulation of their own Minds,
they would be more careful to
strengthen them by Study, and
Moderate them by reason, and
Confirm them by Religion, and
reduce them to an equanimity not
easily disturbed by the Crosses and
Accidents of Life.
Tomorrow leads to the Town of Never

To deny self, to be meek, to be pure in heart
to trust Gods Providence

Love. Joy. Peace long suffering Kindness goodness
faithfulness meekness temperance - can we say
there is not a strong line of demarkation demarcation demarkation between
those who bear such fruit and those who don't

note.q:
and he that is eight days old
shall be circumsised Gen XVII 12 Verse Circumsised Cardinal Number 8

div.note:
One good head is
better than a
great many Hands

div.head: Routine of Work And duty
div.ab:
I advise rising at 6am Summer
and Winter,
Prayers Bath and Shave up to 7
Breakfast from 7.15 to 7.45 including H.C. Hot Cold
Carriage 7.45 to 8 arrive Surrey St Street
In Workshops at 8 prompt seeing to
work until 1pm from 1 to 2 dinner
in private room Hot one day Cold
next leave Surrey St Street at 7pm by
Carriage this to apply to Mon Monday
Tues Tuesday
Wed Wednesday
Thur Thursday
Fri Friday - Saturday each
alternately a holiday.

row.cell:
Juniors holiday alternate Saturdays
Senior ditto each ditto

div.note:
Always open
your own letters
never depute
W.T. William Townsend

div.ab:
In Business - I think if Health
will permit it is a very good thing
to be in the workshops at 2pm to
see all at their work doing it correctly
and properly

Saturdays I think the time
for the one who takes duty might
be 8 to 3 short Cold Lunch making
57 hours whish is more than the
workmen make, to make up for this
the following week he has but 50 hours
to make and which with probable
over minutes will bring the working
Masters hours to an average of
54 hours weekly as at present worked
in Shops

Have Monthly Balancings to

Hook it from M Fox
and Quaterly Balancings
of every Book Debit and Credit
that is what you owe and is owning
to you. say Jan 20 April 20 July 20 Oct 20

Check every item with Day Book from
the Order Book to be sure all is entered
WT William Townsend

Orders in Safe - Cross every
order in Day Book with Red
tick before putting in Safe - the
Red tick signifies there is an
order in the SafeApril 24/91

div.head: Daily Routine
div.ab:
Letters - Works every room and
individual see after Customers
want or Complaint also the same
in Sales Shop I have erred in
leaving the Front Room, I should
have been at the Call more and made
more of Customers by always being
in and not running off to dinner
at any rate
untill until I had had someone
to fill my place well

Examine work before sending home
Charge
Noun
2pm going round the shops

Imp Imperial
8vo octavo to contain
our Trade and where they will such a size of

marked Numbered and priced we can

whatever is in the enormous book in Europe

Sheffield Art Journal

div.ab:
Why I thought a tin Case for each large buyer
was? at any time you thought it declining, you
could run thru through and see at once what was about
due for re-ordering, and try to get it renewed
yourself personally, or some one likely Dec 29/1902

all useless orders; orders that
had become no use? July 16 1909
